DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: CUESTA, H. M.;Cuesta, H. J. M.;Mosquera Cuesta, H. J.;Mosquera Cuesta, Herman J.;Mosquera Cuesta, Herman J;CUESTA, HERMAN J. MOSQUERA

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Bacharel em Engenharia Mecnica pela Universidade de Antioquia - UdeA/Colmbia (1987) e Doutor em Astrofsica pelo Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais - INPE/Brasil (1998). Pesquisador/Fellow Ps-doutoral do Abdus Salam Centro Internacional de Fsica Terica (AS-ICTP, Trieste/Itlia: 1998-2001). Pesquisador Visitante do Centro Europeu de Pesquisa Nuclear (CERN, Geneve: 1999-2001). Principais reas de pesquisa: Astrofsica e Cosmologia Relativsticas, Astrofsica de Altas Energas, Astrofsica Extragalctica, Fsica de Astro-Partculas, Teorias de Gravitao e Eletrodinmica No-Linear. Abrangendo os seguintes tpicos: Teoria das Ondas Gravitacionais, Fontes e Deteco de Ondas Gravitacionais, Astrofsica e Cosmologia de Exploses de Raios-Gamma, Fsica e Astrofsica de Neutrinos, Fsica e Astrofsica de Campos Magnticos Super Fortes em Estrelas Ultra-Compactas, Teorias de Gravitao, Eletrodinmica No-Linear em Gravitao, Astrofsica e Cosmologia, Astrobiologia e Exoplanetologia. Tem longa experincia em ensino/tutoria a nvel universitrio (graduao) em Universidade Estadual Vale do Acara (Sobral/Cear, Brasil: 2010-2013), Universidade Pontifcia Bolivariana, Universidade de Antioquia e Universidade Nacional da Colmbia durante cinco anos (Medelln/Colmbia: 1988-1993). Ao nvel de ps-graduao, ampla experincia em Tutoria de Alunos de Graduao e Iniciao Cientfica, e Supervisor/Orientador de Estudantes de Ps-Graduao. Membro de Conselhos/Bancas de Teses de Doutorado (Ph.D.) e Mestrado (M.Sc.) no Brasil, Itlia e Colmbia. Cientista Visitante de COLCIENCIAS - Programa Nacional de Cincias Bsicas: Cincias Espaciais (Bogot/Colmbia: 2015-2017). Professor/Pesquisador (Long Tenure Track) no Centro Brasileiro de Pesquisas Fsicas (CBPF, Rio de Janeiro: 1998-2010), Pesquisador/Professor Visitante de longo prazo do Centro Internacional de Astrofsica Relativstica (ICRA) e Rede ICRANet (Roma e Pescara, Itlia: 2000-), e do Observatrio da Cte d'Azur (OCA-Nice, Frana: 2002-2004), e do Instituto Koreano de Cincias Avanzadas (KIAS: 2000). rbitro de vrias revistas cientficas: Astronomy and Astrophysics (2010- ), The Astrophysical Journal Letters (2011- ), Canadian Journal of Physics (2017- ), Frontiers in Physics (2018- ), Physica Scripta (2019- ), Foundations of Physics (2008- ), International Journal of Modern Physics D (2020- ), Modern Physics Letters A (2010- ), Entropy (2008- ), International Journal of Astronomy and Astrophysics (2008- ), Universe (2020-), Frontiers in Physics and Frontiers in Astronomy and Space Science.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering from the University of Antioquia - UdeA/Colombia (1987) and PhD in Astrophysics from the National Institute for Space Research - INPE/Brazil (1998). Researcher/Postdoctoral Fellow at Abdus Salam International Center for Theoretical Physics (AS-ICTP, Trieste/Italy: 1998-2001). Visiting Researcher at the European Center for Nuclear Research (CERN, Geneve: 1999-2001). Main research areas: Relativistic Astrophysics and Cosmology, High-Energy Astrophysics, Extragalactic Astrophysics, Astro-Particle Physics, Theories of Gravitation and Nonlinear Electrodynamics. Covering the following topics: Gravitational Wave Theory, Sources and Detection of Gravitational Waves, Astrophysics and Cosmology of Gamma Ray Explosions, Physics and Astrophysics of Neutrinos, Physics and Astrophysics of Super Strong Magnetic Fields in Ultra-Compact Stars, Theories of Gravitation, Nonlinear Electrodynamics in Gravitation; Astrophysics and Cosmology, Astrobiology and Exoplanetology. Long experience in teaching/tutoring/advising at university (undergraduate) level at Vale do Acara State University (Sobral/Cear, Brazil: 2010-2013), Bolivarian Pontifical University, University of Antioquia and National University of Colombia for five years (Medelln/Colombia: 1988-1993). Also extensive experience at graduate level; acting as supervisor/advisor of graduate students. Likewise, Member of Councils/Boards of Doctoral Thesis (Ph.D.) and Master Science Dissertations (M.Sc.) in Brazil, Italy and Colombia. Visiting Scientist at COLCIENCIAS - National Basic Sciences Program: Space Sciences (Bogot/Colombia: 2015-2017). Professor/Researcher (Long Tenure Track) at the Brazilian Center for Research in Physics (CBPF, Rio de Janeiro: 1998-2010), Researcher/Visiting Professor at the International Center for Relativistic Astrophysics (ICRA) and ICRANet Network (Roma e Pescara, Italy: 2000-), and L'Observatoire de la Cte d'Azur (OCA-Nice, France: 2002-2004), and Korean Institute of Advance Sciences (KIAS: 2000). Referee for several scientific journals: Astronomy and Astrophysics (2010-), The Astrophysical Journal Letters (2011-), Canadian Journal of Physics (2017-), Frontiers in Physics (2018-), Physica Scripta (2019-), Foundations of Physics (2008-), International Journal of Modern Physics D (2020-), Modern Physics Letters A (2010-), Entropy (2008-), International Journal of Astronomy and Astrophysics (2008-), Universe (2020-), Frontiers in Physics and Frontiers in Astronomy and Space Science.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Gravitational wave emission from disc/jet precession and superluminal ejection of jet components in active galactic nuclei and micro-quasars
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Em 1915, Einstein publicou sua teoria da gravita\cao: A {\it Teoria
Geral da Relatividade} (TGR). Essa teoria sugere que a estrutura
fundamental do Universo \'e o {\it espa\c co-tempo} (ST), uma esp\'ecie
de tecido global que o cont\'em tudo e interage com tudo. Esta vis\~ao
descreve a intera\cao gravitacional entre corpos materiais, ou
simplesmente {\it gravita\cao}, como o resultado de um efeito
geom\'etrico que faz o ST sofrer deforma\cao, ou {\it curvatura}, ao
serem colocadas nele distribui\coes de mat\'eria como gal\'axias,
estrelas, planetas, etc. Se perturbada, esta curvatura produz uma onda 
de espa\c co-tempo, ou uma onda gravitacional (OG). Portanto, uma onda 
gravitacional \'e uma {\it onda de curvatura}! (a curvatura \'e fraca 
longe da fonte, e muito intensa nas suas vizinhan\c cas). Em analogia 
com a eletrodin\^amica de Maxwell, na qual ondas eletromagn\'eticas 
s\~ao produzidas por cargas el\'etricas aceleradas, na TGR as OGs 
s\~ao produzidas ao ser acelerado um corpo material ou uma massa. 

O objetivo deste projeto \'e investigar se processos como a eje\cao de 
um pulsar do casulo em que nasce ap\'os a explos\~ao de supernova, (o 
denominado `{\it kick at birth}'), \'e uma fonte importante de OGs. 
Esta relev\^ancia ser\'a quantificada em termos da detectabilidade do 
sinal produzido durante essa fase de acelera\cao inicial.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Gamma-ray bursts (GRBs) are the biggest explosions in the universe. For brief instants they outshine their host galaxies. The major breakthrough in understanding of GRBs came with the Beppo-SAX satellite discovery of the X-ray afterglow of GRB970228 (Costa et al. 1997). A swift follow-up of this event allows the subsequent detection of residual optical and radio emissions from this transient (van Paradijs et al. 1997; Frail et al. 1997). From these afterglows the first measurement of the redshift of a GRB was done, what definitely confirmed a long-standing suspicion that GRBs have cosmological origin. 

Purpose: a) to investigate whether the energy conditions of general relativity (GR), when enforced on the standard cosmological FLRW model, can bring it across with the Hubble diagrams constructed from the sample of GRBs that have redshifts measured through spectroscopy or other methods (like photometry). This way, confrontation of the GRB Hubble diagram for each of the GR ECs imposed on the FLRW model should provide complementary constraints on any putative violation of the ECs in the FLRW cosmological model because the distance-scale spanned by this study is definitely much larger than that to which SNIa observations can reach. Thence, the approach renders the conclusions achieved to throughout such class of analysis of extreme relevance for current cosmography purposes. 

b) to search for the fundamental Physics underlying the empirical relations that have been discovered within observations of GRBs. This study may include to take into consideration the astrophysical scenarios invoked to explain the bursts emission mechanism. 

c) to perform tests using GRBs observations on the prediction of either extended theories of gravity or alternative cosmological models.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Colombia en la Era Espacial (Colombia Stepping into the Space Era)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Goal: (In Spanish) - Prolegmena: El englobante trmino Ciencia Espacial fue acuado para describir los diversos campos de investigacin cientfica que se ocupan del estudio del Universo, y generalmente significan excluir del estudio tanto a la Tierra como tambin al espacio exterior a la atmsfera terrestre. (Originalmente tales reas fueron consideradas parte de la Astronoma). Las Ciencias del Espacio son el tema central del presente proyecto, desarrollado para COLCIENCIAS, con el cual se busca aportar al desarrollo cientfico y tecnolgico del pas en Asuntos Espaciales a travs de la elaboracin y presentacin de un documento propuesta (White Paper) con el cual sustentar el por que Colombia debe adentrarse en la Era Espacial. Tal documento presentar argumentos en favor de la creacin de un Centro Nacional de Investigaciones Espaciales que produzca ciencia y desarrolle tecnologa para campos como astronoma, astrofsica, astronutica, ingeniera aeroespacial y reas afines, diseo y construccin de satlites, meteorologa, clima y medio ambiente, percepcin remota, entre otras reas cientficas. Igualmente, tal documento proveer elementos que ayudan a comprender por que es necesario, en estos tiempos que vive el pas, el emplazar en rbita nuestro primer satlite geoestacionario, y crear infra-estructuras que permitan aprovechar esa tecnologa, e que fortalezcan la incursin de Colombia en la Era Espacial. 

As siendo, la puesta en marcha del Programa Espacial de Colombia, con todo lo que tal proyecto estratgico nacional implica, es ante todo una invitacin a ponernos al comps de los ms recientes avances en Exploracin Espacial. Esa iniciativa nos debe llevar tambin a apropiarnos de nuestro espacio exterior y a formular polticas pblicas para su uso en beneficio del pas, a definir rbitas para el emplazamiento de nuestros satlites y para potenciales usos en navegacin espacial. Igualmente, tal empresa nos permitir realizar estudios de la atmsfera superior, tierra y mares desde el espacio, principalmente en estos tiempos en que nos acechan conflictos fronterizos tanto en la regin insular con Nicaragua, bien como en el territorio continental con Venezuela y Ecuador, en donde la proteccin de las fronteras y la seguridad nacional estn siendo confrontadas. ms an, tales argumentos apuntarn tambin al papel que deben jugar en el contexto geo-poltico global las naciones emergentes, como Colombia, en Asuntos del Espacio. Reflexiones sobre estas temticas son inherentes al presente proyecto, y han sido conmensuradas con los principios rectores (misin y visin institucional) y objetivos del ente nacional creado para brindar asesora al Estado Colombiano en Asuntos del Espacio: La Comisin Colombiana del Espacio (CCE).

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Nonlinear electrodynamics in astrophysics and cosmology

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
A bunch of theoretical and astrophysical arguments call for taking into account the effects of super
strong electromagnetic fields and rotation during the late stages of core-collapse supernovae. In what
follows we solve Einstein field equations minimally coupled to an arbitrary (current-free) Born-Infeld
nonlinear Lagrangian L(F, G) of electrodynamics (NLED) in the slow rotation regime a ≪ r+ (outer
horizon size), up to first order in a/r. We perform a cross-check of the physical properties of such
NLED space-time w.r.t. the Maxwellian one. A study case on both neutrino flavor (νe → ν, ντ )
oscillations and flavor+helicity (spin) flip (νe → ν,τ ) gyroscopic precession proves that in the spacetime
of a slowly rotating nonlinear charged black hole (RNCBH) the neutrino dynamics translates into
a positive enhancement of the r-process (reduction of the electron fraction Ye < 0.5). Consequently
it guarantees successful hyperluminous core-collapse supernova explosions due to enlargement of the
number and amount of decaying nuclides species. This posits that, as far as the whole luminosity may
concern, hypernovae would be the proof of the formation of astrophysical RNCBH.
